lead_paragraph: GERINGER--Harold Irving, a remarkable father and grandfather, devoted husband, wonderful friend, loving brother, and dedicated lawyer passed away February 23, 2016, at the age of 84. Harold was preceded by his beloved wife Eleanore, parents, Nathan and Betty, and brother, Martin. Left to cherish his memory are his children Geoffrey Geringer, Laura Gross and husband Fredric, Elizabeth Lieberman and husband Gary, devoted grandchildren, Benjamin, Alyson, and Rachel Gross, and Spencer Lieberman, sister Ann Lieberman (Leo), brother Saul Geringer (Martha), Harold and Sylvia Nissen, special friend Phyllis Gershon and many nieces and nephews, and lifelong friends who supported Harold until the end. A founding partner of Geringer, McNamara, & Horowitz, LLP, originally Lian & Geringer, Harold graduated from City College of New York and Brooklyn Law School, and practiced law until two weeks before his death. Harold loved being with his family, especially on his boat the "We II." He was also devoted to serving his community and never said no to a charitable request - resulting in a collection of "give aways" from various groups. Harold was President of Temple Israel of South Merrick and supported many organizations committed to Israel. A graveside service will be on Sunday, February 28, 2016 at 10:30am at the New Montefiore Cemetery, after which the family will be at Harold's apartment to receive friends. Memorial contributions may be made in memory of Harold to the Icahn School of Medicine, Mt. Sinai Hospital, for MDS/AML Research/Dr. Navada Fund. 1/3
